name: Jordan
description: Jordan, a captivating nation nestled at the crossroads of Asia and Africa, boasts a rich history, diverse landscapes, and a resilient culture. From the arid deserts of the east to the fertile plains of the west, Jordan offers a unique blend of ancient ruins, dramatic mountains, and the life-giving waters of the Jordan River.  Its strategic location has made it a pivotal point in human civilization for millennia, and today, it’s a country striving to balance tradition with modernity, welcoming visitors with open arms and a wealth of experiences.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Jordan's population is a mix of diverse ethnic groups, primarily Arab, with significant Bedouin communities.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban centers like Amman, Irbid, and Zarqa.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Amman, the vibrant capital, is a bustling metropolis blending ancient and modern architecture.
quickFacts.detail: It’s Jordan’s largest city and a hub for commerce, culture, and education.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Jordan is a relatively small country, easily traversed but packed with diverse landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: It’s bordered by Syria to the north, Iraq to the northeast, Saudi Arabia to the east, and Israel and the Palestinian territories to the south.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Modern Standard Arabic is the official language, with various dialects spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: English is widely spoken, particularly in tourist areas and business settings.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Jordanian Dinar is pegged to the US dollar.
quickFacts.detail: Credit cards are widely accepted in urban areas, but cash is still useful in smaller towns and villages.

climateData.title: Jordan's Climate
climateData.description: Jordan experiences a hot, arid climate with significant seasonal variations. Summers are scorching, while winters are mild and relatively wet, particularly in the north.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Long, hot, and dry summers dominate the landscape. Daytime temperatures frequently exceed 40°C (104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to cool, and rainfall increases, bringing a welcome respite from the summer heat.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild and wet winters prevail, with temperatures ranging from 10°C to 20°C (50°F to 68°F). Snowfall is common in the mountainous regions.
activities: Skiing (in Amman and Aqaba),  Winter hiking, Visiting Petra

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings blossoming landscapes and pleasant temperatures, making it an ideal time to visit Jordan.

naturalWonders.name: Petra
naturalWonders.description: Petra, the 'Lost City,' is a UNESCO World Heritage site carved into sandstone cliffs. It was the capital of the Nabataean kingdom and is renowned for its stunning architecture and intricate water systems.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The city’s elaborate facades, including the Treasury and the Monastery, are a testament to the ingenuity and artistry of the Nabataeans.  It’s a breathtaking spectacle that has captivated visitors for centuries.

naturalWonders.name: Wadi Rum
naturalWonders.description: Wadi Rum, also known as the Valley of the Moon, is a protected desert wilderness characterized by towering sandstone mountains, dramatic rock formations, and vast sand dunes.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This otherworldly landscape has been featured in numerous films and documentaries, including Lawrence of Arabia.  It offers unparalleled opportunities for adventure and exploration.
viewingTips: Consider a camel or jeep tour

naturalWonders.name: Dead Sea
naturalWonders.description: The Dead Sea is the lowest point on Earth's surface and is renowned for its exceptionally high salt content, allowing visitors to float effortlessly.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Its mineral-rich waters are believed to have therapeutic properties. The surrounding landscape is a unique and surreal environment.

ecosystemData.title: Jordan's Diverse Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Jordan’s ecosystems range from arid deserts to fertile valleys and mountainous highlands, supporting a remarkable array of plant and animal life. Conservation efforts are crucial to protect these valuable resources.

biodiversityCategories.name: Desert Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Dominated by sand dunes, rocky plateaus, and sparse vegetation, these ecosystems are home to specialized plants and animals adapted to extreme conditions.

statistics.details: Many endemic species are found in the desert.
Includes reptiles, insects, and desert foxes.

notableSpecies.name: Dorcas Gazelle
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator species for desert health.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mediterranean Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Located along the coast, these ecosystems are characterized by olive groves, citrus orchards, and Mediterranean vegetation.

statistics.details: Rich biodiversity due to favorable climate and soil conditions.
Includes migratory birds and various reptiles.

notableSpecies.name: Barbary Macaque
notableSpecies.significance: Unique to the Dead Sea region.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Jordan
activities.description: Jordan offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and camping to water sports and cultural tours.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Jordan’s diverse landscapes on foot, from the rugged mountains to the vast deserts.

activities.name: Petra Trail
activities.description: A challenging hike through the Siq to reach the Treasury and other iconic sites in Petra.

activities.name: Wadi Rum Trekking
activities.description: Explore the stunning landscapes of Wadi Rum on foot, accompanied by a Bedouin guide.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities in the Dead Sea and the Red Sea.

activities.name: Dead Sea Swimming
activities.description: Float effortlessly in the mineral-rich waters of the Dead Sea.

activities.name: Red Sea Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life of the Red Sea.

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, swimwear, hat, sunglasses
clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, scarf, gloves
clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen, insect repellent

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
